fact: The UK probably needs to leave the single market to implement an Australia-style points-based system.
Norway and Switzerland - which are not in the EU but that are in the European Economic - have higher rates of EU immigration than the UK does at the moment.
Leaving the single market could be expensive for the UK economy.
How many people would be let in with a points-based system will depend on the rules on letting people in.
The UK is unable to control the number of EU immigrants to the UK before it has officially left the EU.
Immigrants make a net financial contribution to the UK.
